text:
Eighty-seven Indians, mostly fishermen arrested in Pakistan for allegedly violating its territorial waters, were on Monday handed over to India on the Wagah border after being released from prison.

The Indian nationals were freed from the Landhi Jail in Karachi on Sunday.

“After releasing 87 Indians, we now have a total of 457 more (Indians) in the prison, and most of them are fishermen,” Landhi jail’s deputy superintendent Shakir Shah told Pakistan’s The Express Tribune . “Some 86 more Indians are likely to be released on March 20,” he said.

18 fishermen arrested

Meanwhile, the Pakistan Maritime Security Agency apprehended 18 Indian fishermen and seized their three boats off the Gujarat coast on Sunday, the National Fishworkers Forum (NFF) said on Monday. — PTI
title: Pakistan hands over 87 freed prisoners to India
